pull.title: test: Check that reindex with prune wipes blk files
pull.body: This adds missing test coverage for `CleanupBlockRevFiles`.

verification.payload:
tree 4dab57e429901fa346116eeba9b82d4ec1c87c62
parent eb243ff06c46a2a465741733b3c15485d529d8c3
author MarcoFalke <*~=`'#}+{/-|&$^_@721217.xyz> 1737455215 +0100
committer MarcoFalke <*~=`'#}+{/-|&$^_@721217.xyz> 1737454785 +0100

test: Use high-level python types

Using the built-in open() and pathlib is identical and requires less code.

Also, remove redundant sync_blocks call.

events.message:
test: Use high-level python types

Using the built-in open() and pathlib is identical and requires less code.

Also, remove redundant sync_blocks call.

verification.payload:
tree cb805b89be0c0f9951b29aaca0e6194f40c283a1
parent fa9593efc2e19d9dfa9a62c8a3d796aad888baa0
author MarcoFalke <*~=`'#}+{/-|&$^_@721217.xyz> 1737457664 +0100
committer MarcoFalke <*~=`'#}+{/-|&$^_@721217.xyz> 1737532324 +0100

test: Check that reindex with prune wipes blk files

events.message: test: Check that reindex with prune wipes blk files

events.body:
ACK fa9aced8006bd9b10b9239b43140c37162c9d8f2

Left a few nits

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -18,38 +19,48 @@ def mine_batches(self, blocks):
         for _ in range(n):
             self.generate(self.nodes[0], 250)
         self.generate(self.nodes[0], blocks % 250)
-        self.sync_blocks()
 
     def run_test(self):
         blk0 = self.nodes[0].blocks_path / "blk00000.dat"
         rev0 = self.nodes[0].blocks_path / "rev00000.dat"
         blk1 = self.nodes[0].blocks_path / "blk00001.dat"
         rev1 = self.nodes[0].blocks_path / "rev00001.dat"
         self.mine_batches(800)
-        fo1 = os.open(blk0, os.O_RDONLY)
-        fo2 = os.open(rev1, os.O_RDONLY)
-        fd1 = os.fdopen(fo1)
-        fd2 = os.fdopen(fo2)
+
+        self.log.info("Open some files to check that this may delay deletion")
+        fd1 = open(blk0, "rb")
+        fd2 = open(rev1, "rb")
         self.nodes[0].pruneblockchain(600)
 
         # Windows systems will not remove files with an open fd
         if platform.system() != 'Windows':
-            assert not os.path.exists(blk0)
-            assert not os.path.exists(rev0)
-            assert not os.path.exists(blk1)
-            assert not os.path.exists(rev1)
+            assert not blk0.exists()
+            assert not rev0.exists()
+            assert not blk1.exists()
+            assert not rev1.exists()
         else:
-            assert os.path.exists(blk0)
-            assert not os.path.exists(rev0)
-            assert not os.path.exists(blk1)
-            assert os.path.exists(rev1)
+            assert blk0.exists()
+            assert not rev0.exists()
+            assert not blk1.exists()
+            assert rev1.exists()
 
-        # Check that the files are removed on restart once the fds are closed
+        self.log.info("Check that the files are removed on restart once the fds are closed")
         fd1.close()
         fd2.close()
         self.restart_node(0)
-        assert not os.path.exists(blk0)
-        assert not os.path.exists(rev1)
+        assert not blk0.exists()
+        assert not rev1.exists()
+
+        self.log.info("Check that a reindex will wipe all files")
comments.body: Might it be good to check the file count here before deletion during the reindex?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -50,6 +51,20 @@ def run_test(self):
         assert not blk0.exists()
         assert not rev1.exists()
 
+        self.log.info("Check that a reindex will wipe all files")
+
+        def file_count():
+            return sum(
+                entry.is_file() and any(map(entry.name.startswith, ["rev", "blk"]))
+                for entry in self.nodes[0].blocks_path.iterdir()
+            )
+
+        assert_equal(file_count(), 4)
comments.body:
nit:
If retouching, could increase readability with a comment or log explaining that the check is for presence of non-00000/00001 files (blk00002.dat/rev00002.dat/blk00003.dat/rev00003.dat)

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -50,6 +51,20 @@ def run_test(self):
         assert not blk0.exists()
         assert not rev1.exists()
 
+        self.log.info("Check that a reindex will wipe all files")
+
+        def file_count():
+            return sum(
+                entry.is_file() and any(map(entry.name.startswith, ["rev", "blk"]))
+                for entry in self.nodes[0].blocks_path.iterdir()
+            )
+
+        assert_equal(file_count(), 4)
+        self.restart_node(0, extra_args=self.extra_args[0] + ["-reindex"])
+        assert_equal(self.nodes[0].getblockcount(), 0)
+        self.stop_node(0)  # Stop node to flush the two newly created files
+        assert_equal(file_count(), 2)
comments.body:
nit:
and for presence of blk00000.dat/rev00000.dat

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -50,6 +51,20 @@ def run_test(self):

+        self.log.info("Check that a reindex will wipe all files")

+        assert_equal(file_count(), 4)

+        assert_equal(self.nodes[0].getblockcount(), 0)
+        self.stop_node(0)  # Stop node to flush the two newly created files
+        assert_equal(file_count(), 2)
comments.body: thx, used an exact match here on the filenames

comments.body:
Wasn't sure what "may delay deletion" referred to, had to read the whole test to understand it, maybe this could help:
```suggestion
        self.log.info("Check that opening files may delay their deletion")
```

comments.body:
Given that this pr was about `identical and requires less code`, it seems to me we can express this in a more compact form as well:
```suggestion
        ls_files = lambda: sorted(f.name for f in self.nodes[0].blocks_path.glob("*0*.dat"))
```

comments.body:
> Given that this pr was about `identical and requires less code`, it seems to me we can express this in a more compact form as well:

No, this pr is about "This adds missing test coverage" (see the description). The other commit isn't needed and I am happy to drop it, if you want.

Also, I don't think your glob is identical, because it can match dat files other than rev/blk (also hidden files). This may or may not be fine right now, but I am even less sure about the future.

comments.body:
> Also, I don't think your glob is identical, because it can match dat files other than rev/blk

Got it, what do you think about:
```python
ls_files = lambda: sorted(f.name for f in self.nodes[0].blocks_path.iterdir() if f.name.startswith(("rev", "blk")))
```

comments.body:
> I am happy to drop it, if you want.

Of course not, what I want is maintainable code with high signal-to-noise ratio.
But if you don't think my alternative suggestions make the code more maintainable, I'm not forcing you to accept it, I've already ACK-ed.

comments.body: This already has two acks, so I think it is better to leave it as-is and keep the `[ ]` for now, even if they are redundant.
